# AIOS-FULLSTACK v2.1 Quick Start Guide

**Version:** 2.1.0
**Last Updated:** 2025-11-24
**Installation Time:** ~5 minutes
**Prerequisites:** Node.js 18+, npm 9+

---

## Table of Contents

- [Overview](#overview)
- [Prerequisites](#prerequisites)
- [Quick Start (5 Minutes)](#quick-start-5-minutes)
- [Installation Methods](#installation-methods)
- [Interactive Wizard Walkthrough](#interactive-wizard-walkthrough)
- [Configuration Options](#configuration-options)
- [Validation & Verification](#validation--verification)
- [Post-Installation Setup](#post-installation-setup)
- [IDE-Specific Configuration](#ide-specific-configuration)
- [Next Steps](#next-steps)

---

## Overview

AIOS-FULLSTACK is a universal AI agent framework for full-stack development. It provides:

- **11+ Specialized Agents**: Developer, QA, Architect, PM, PO, SM, and more
- **Multi-IDE Support**: Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, Trae, Roo Code, Cline, Gemini CLI, GitHub Copilot
- **Task Workflows**: Pre-built workflows for story development, code review, and deployment
- **Expansion Packs**: Optional add-ons like HybridOps for ClickUp integration

---

## Prerequisites

### Required Software

| Component   | Minimum Version | Check Command    |
| ----------- | --------------- | ---------------- |
| **Node.js** | 18.0.0+         | `node --version` |
| **npm**     | 9.0.0+          | `npm --version`  |
| **Git**     | 2.30+           | `git --version`  |

### System Requirements

| Platform    | Requirements                             |
| ----------- | ---------------------------------------- |
| **Windows** | Windows 10/11, PowerShell 5.1+ or CMD    |
| **macOS**   | macOS 12+ (Monterey or later)            |
| **Linux**   | Ubuntu 20.04+, Debian 11+, or equivalent |

### Verify Prerequisites

```bash
# Check Node.js version (must be 18+)
node --version

# Check npm version (must be 9+)
npm --version

# Check Git version
git --version
```

If Node.js is not installed or outdated:

- **Windows/macOS**: Download from [nodejs.org](https://nodejs.org/)
- **Linux**: Use nvm (`curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash`)

---

## Quick Start (5 Minutes)

### Option 1: npx Installation (Recommended)

```bash
# Navigate to your project directory
cd /path/to/your/project

# Run the interactive installer
npx aios-fullstack install
```

### Option 2: Global Installation

```bash
# Install globally
npm install -g aios-fullstack

# Run installer in any project
cd /path/to/your/project
aios-fullstack install
```

### Option 3: Direct Installation with Options

```bash
# Full installation with specific IDEs
npx aios-fullstack install --full --ide cursor claude-code

# Install only expansion packs
npx aios-fullstack install --expansion-only --expansion-packs hybrid-ops
```

---

## Installation Methods

### Interactive Mode (Default)

When you run `npx aios-fullstack install` without options, the installer launches an interactive wizard:

```

üöÄ Universal AI Agent Framework for Any Domain
‚ú® Installer v1.2.3
```

### CLI Mode (Non-Interactive)

For automation and CI/CD pipelines:

```bash
# Full installation
npx aios-fullstack install --full --directory /path/to/project --ide claude-code cursor

# Expansion packs only
npx aios-fullstack install --expansion-only --expansion-packs hybrid-ops

# Force upgrade existing installation
npx aios-fullstack install --full --force-upgrade
```

---

## Interactive Wizard Walkthrough

### Step 1: Project Directory

```
? Enter the full path to your project directory where AIOS should be installed:
> /path/to/my-project
```

Enter the absolute path to your project. The installer will detect any existing AIOS installation.

### Step 2: Select Components

```
? Select what to install/update (use space to select, enter to continue):
‚ùØ ‚óâ AIOS Core System (v1.2.3) .aios-core
  ‚óØ HybridOps (v1.0.0) .hybrid-ops
```

Use **SPACEBAR** to toggle selections, **ENTER** to continue.

### Step 3: Document Organization

```
üìã Document Organization Settings

? Will the PRD (Product Requirements Document) be sharded into multiple files? (Y/n)
? Will the architecture documentation be sharded into multiple files? (Y/n)
```

**Sharding** splits large documents into smaller, manageable files:

- **Sharded (Recommended)**: PRD split into `docs/prd/` directory
- **Single file**: One large document

### Step 4: IDE Configuration

```
üõ†Ô∏è  IDE Configuration
‚ö†Ô∏è  IMPORTANT: This is a MULTISELECT! Use SPACEBAR to toggle each IDE!

? Which IDE(s) do you want to configure?
‚ùØ ‚óØ Cursor
  ‚óØ Claude Code
  ‚óØ Windsurf
  ‚óØ Trae
  ‚óØ Roo Code
  ‚óØ Cline
  ‚óØ Gemini CLI
  ‚óØ Github Copilot
```

Select all IDEs you use. The installer creates the appropriate configuration files for each.

### Step 5: Web Bundles (Optional)

```
? Would you like to include pre-built web bundles? (y/N)
```

Web bundles are standalone files for web-based AI platforms (ChatGPT, Claude Web, Gemini).

### Step 6: Installation Complete

```
‚úÖ Installation complete!

Files created:
  .aios-core/                 # Framework core
  .claude/commands/           # Claude Code agents
  docs/                       # Documentation structure

Next steps:
  1. Restart your IDE
  2. Try activating an agent: @dev or /dev
  3. Run *help to see available commands
```

---

## Configuration Options

### Command Line Options

| Option                             | Description                      | Example                 |
| ---------------------------------- | -------------------------------- | ----------------------- |
| `--full`                           | Install complete AIOS-FULLSTACK  | `--full`                |
| `--expansion-only`                 | Install only expansion packs     | `--expansion-only`      |
| `-d, --directory <path>`           | Installation directory           | `-d /path/to/project`   |
| `-i, --ide <ide...>`               | Configure for specific IDE(s)    | `-i cursor claude-code` |
| `-e, --expansion-packs <packs...>` | Install specific expansion packs | `-e hybrid-ops`         |
| `--force-upgrade`                  | Upgrade without prompting        | `--force-upgrade`       |

### Supported IDEs

| IDE            | Value            | Agent Activation    |
| -------------- | ---------------- | ------------------- |
| Cursor         | `cursor`         | `@dev`, `@qa`, etc. |
| Claude Code    | `claude-code`    | `/dev`, `/qa`, etc. |
| Windsurf       | `windsurf`       | `@dev`, `@qa`, etc. |
| Trae           | `trae`           | `@dev`, `@qa`, etc. |
| Roo Code       | `roo`            | Mode selector       |
| Cline          | `cline`          | `@dev`, `@qa`, etc. |
| Gemini CLI     | `gemini`         | Mention in prompt   |
| GitHub Copilot | `github-copilot` | Chat modes          |

### Available Expansion Packs

| Pack         | Description                             |
| ------------ | --------------------------------------- |
| `hybrid-ops` | ClickUp integration, process automation |

---

## Validation & Verification

After installation, verify the setup:

### 1. Check File Structure

```bash
# Verify .aios-core exists
ls -la .aios-core/

# Expected output:
# agents/          # 11+ agent definitions
# tasks/           # 60+ task workflows
# templates/       # 20+ document templates
# checklists/      # Validation checklists
# core-config.yaml # Framework configuration
```

### 2. Verify IDE Configuration

**Claude Code:**

```bash
ls -la .claude/commands/
# Expected: Agent markdown files (dev.md, qa.md, etc.)
```

**Cursor:**

```bash
ls -la .cursor/rules/
# Expected: Agent rule files (dev.mdc, qa.mdc, etc.)
```

### 3. Test Agent Activation

In your IDE:

- **Claude Code**: Type `/dev` and press Enter
- **Cursor**: Type `@dev` in chat
- **Others**: Use the IDE-specific activation method

Expected result: The agent introduces itself with its persona and available commands.

### 4. Run Status Command

```bash
npx aios-fullstack status
```

Expected output:

```
AIOS-FULLSTACK Status
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
Version: 1.2.3
Install Location: /path/to/project
Core: ‚úÖ Installed
IDEs Configured: claude-code, cursor
Expansion Packs: hybrid-ops
```

---

## Post-Installation Setup

### 1. Configure Environment Variables

Create a `.env` file in your project root:

```bash
# API Keys (optional, for MCP integrations)
CLICKUP_API_KEY=your-clickup-key
GITHUB_TOKEN=your-github-token
```

### 2. Configure core-config.yaml

The `.aios-core/core-config.yaml` file contains framework settings:

```yaml
# Document locations
prd:
  prdFile: docs/prd.md
  prdVersion: v4
  prdSharded: true
  prdShardedLocation: docs/prd

architecture:
  architectureFile: docs/architecture.md
  architectureSharded: true
  architectureShardedLocation: docs/architecture

# Story location
devStoryLocation: docs/stories
```

### 3. Initialize Documentation Structure

The installer creates the documentation structure, but you may want to customize:

```bash
# Create initial PRD
touch docs/prd.md

# Create architecture doc
touch docs/architecture.md

# Create first story
mkdir -p docs/stories
```

---

## IDE-Specific Configuration

### Claude Code

Files created: `.claude/commands/AIOS/agents/*.md`

**Usage:**

1. Open Claude Code
2. Type `/` to see available commands
3. Select an agent (e.g., `/dev`)
4. Use `*help` to see agent commands

### Cursor

Files created: `.cursor/rules/*.mdc`

**Usage:**

1. Open Cursor
2. Press `Ctrl+L` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+L` (Mac)
3. Type `@agent-name` (e.g., `@dev`)
4. The agent adopts its persona

### Windsurf

Files created: `.windsurf/rules/*.md`

**Usage:**

1. Open Windsurf chat
2. Type `@agent-name` (e.g., `@dev`)
3. The agent adopts its persona

### Roo Code

Files created: `.roomodes`

**Usage:**

1. Open mode selector in status bar
2. Select any `bmad-{agent}` mode
3. The AI adopts that agent's capabilities

### GitHub Copilot

Files created: `.github/chatmodes/*.md`

**Usage:**

1. Open Chat view (`Ctrl+Alt+I` on Windows/Linux, `‚åÉ‚åòI` on Mac)
2. Select **Agent** from chat mode selector
3. Requires VS Code 1.101+ with `chat.agent.enabled: true`

---

## Next Steps

### 1. Explore Available Agents

| Agent       | Purpose                     | Activation                   |
| ----------- | --------------------------- | ---------------------------- |
| `dev`       | Full-stack development      | `/dev` or `@dev`             |
| `qa`        | Quality assurance, testing  | `/qa` or `@qa`               |
| `architect` | System design, architecture | `/architect` or `@architect` |
| `pm`        | Project management          | `/pm` or `@pm`               |
| `po`        | Product ownership, backlog  | `/po` or `@po`               |
| `sm`        | Scrum facilitation          | `/sm` or `@sm`               |
| `analyst`   | Business analysis           | `/analyst` or `@analyst`     |

### 2. Create Your First Story

```bash
# Activate Product Owner agent
/po

# Create a new story
*create-story
```

### 3. Implement a Story

```bash
# Activate Developer agent
/dev

# Develop a story
*develop docs/stories/your-story.md
```

### 4. Run Tests

```bash
# Activate QA agent
/qa

# Review implementation
*review docs/stories/your-story.md
```
